reviews.title: Great Location!!
reviews.text: We have just come back from staying at this hotel for three nights. We had a great time, the reception staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was perfect for what we needed. The best thing about this hotel is the location, it is only about 10 minutes walk from the main square, and very near all the main sights. The hotel was maybe not as cheap as we would have expected, but this is probably due to the excellent location. Overall, a very good base to explore Krakow from.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Alexander for 3 nights, last March. We were really satified with the hotel. Well located, just a few minutes walking to the city center. Rooms are big enough, and very clean ! The staff was kind. We'v had a really nice breakfast with a wide range of foods. Once we've had a dinner at the hotel's restaurant, and that was also nice. The only missing thing is the parking. We could leave our car not far from the hotel, but it wasn't cheap. If I remember well, about 15 € / day.I've booked the room via travelpoland.com, which was much more cheaper than the official website of the hotel. About 45 € / day / double instead of paying 75 €.
reviews.title: Great deal !

reviews.text: Krakow is a very nice city, full of interesting things. If you're there don't miss Auschwitz, and the salt mine in Wieliczka ! And of course stay at Alexander !
reviews.title: Give it a Go

reviews.text: A group of nine went out to this hotel at the end of February. We are all work colleagues on a midweek short break.
reviews.title: Very impressed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was suprisingly well placed and very central to the city.
reviews.title: Loved the alexander

likes.disliked: — no te/coffee macking facilities in room

reviews.text: We travelled here in early July 2007, the hotel is in a perfect location for walking around Krakow. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff were very friendly with excellant English.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

likes.disliked: — No tea or coffee in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town centre is beautiful and within about 5 minutes walk from the hotel, leaving it in a quiet location away from the bars at night. The bars and restaurants are lovely and at this time, very inexpensive, no doubt the prices will rise when the tourists become more popular. Krakow is a lovely and interesting place to visit, there is plenty to see and do and even if you just wish to sit in the town square with a cup of coffee or a glass of wine and watch the world go by, it is a place that everyone will find inspiring. I would highly recommend it for a city break and this hotel is perfect for that purpose.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Central Location

reviews.text: We went to Poland on the 28th August we flew from Belfast to Katowice and flew with Wizzair their was a 6hour delay which wasn't so good but when we got on the plane we really liked it as it was a really new plane which made us feel safe as we didn't really no the airline.
reviews.title: Good Value at the Alexander

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got to Katowice we got the pre booked bus (on Wizzair website) to Krakow which took approx 1 and a half hours the journey it self was not to bad as you got to see a bit of Poland.
reviews.title: What a great hotel

reviews.text: When we got to the hotel we were impressed by the quick checkin and our room was awaiting for our heads to hit the pillows!!! The room itself was quite small but more than adequate for us, the room came with a mini bar TV ensuite with a very large shower but no bath which didn't bother me. The room was cleaned on a daily basis and the mini bar was always stocked up each day. The hotel is right in the centre of things and the main square is only a small walk away the hotel reception staff at this hotel were excellent and really did go out of their way to help us with anything we needed they were super!!!
reviews.title: It has some good and some bad points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Alexander.
reviews.title: Excellent, central hotel

reviews.text: Location is always paramount when I decide which hotel to stay in and this one couldnt have been better. The hotel is located down a quiet street - with a post office, early-morning bakery and corner shop nearby - just 5 minutes walk from the busy Main Square of Krakow. The Main Square, or Rynek Glowny to the locals, really is where it's at in Krakow - outdoor bars and restaurants are all over the place, the imposing Cloth Hall houses dozens of stalls selling souveniers and lots and lots of amber, and many of the beautiful old town houses surrounding the square host intimate nightly concerts of Chopin and Mozart music. So for the hotel tobe within a short walking distance of this bustlign hub was a real bonus.
reviews.title: Excellent service, excellent location

likes.disliked: — noisy neighbors - not soundproofed well enough

reviews.text: The hotel itself was very clean and looked recently built or refurbished. Certainly our double room was spotless and the bathroom - apart from the awkward 'open' shower - was lovely. The staff were friendly and most spoke English, and the breakfast was a good mix of cold meats, cheeses, breads, kabanos (hot Polish sausage) and boiled/scrambled eggs.
reviews.title: nice city shame about the pollution

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I sais it's really the location, as well as the price, which sells this hotel. Though Krakow itself is a relatively small city and all the major attraction like Wawel Castle and the Jewish District can be reached on foot, it was handy having the hotel so close by to the Main Square, especially as that is where most of the good restaurants and bars are, so it was only a short stagger home of an evening.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the city itself, I would recommend visiting one of the four Chlopskie Jadlo restaurants which serve traditional Polish soups and meat dishes at a very reasonable price in lovely surroundings. The nearest one to the Sqaure is at ul Jana 3. Also the Tram Bar on Ul Stolarksa serves cheap cocktails!
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — No tea or coffee facilities in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had four nights at the Alexander Hotel and my wife and I regarded it as a very good choice. It carries three stars but from our observations it is 3star+.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a smallish hotel with reception, small bar and dining room on the ground floor. Our room was situated on the fourth floor and all aspects of it were to our satisfaction. Two comfortable chairs, a desk, a small table, toilet with shower, twin beds,
reviews.title: A recommended stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: fridge/mini bar and good storage and hanging space were all appreciated.
reviews.title: Alexander Hotel, Garbarska Street,Krakow

reviews.text: All staff had some english and the reception staff were fluent. What is perhaps more important they were all very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Kracking hotel in Krakow

reviews.text: If you want to spend a few days in Krakow, and I can recommend it, you should not look further than the Alexander. For what it is worth we noted signs in the hotel indicating that it was a Polish Hotel of the year in 2005 and 2006.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
